intro: Cyphostemma adenanthum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
